content.question: A sample of an ideal gas at <math alttext="P sub i" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is initially confined to one chamber of the apparatus represented above, and the other chamber is initially evacuated. Which of the following best describes <math alttext="delta S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the process?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta S is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because the pressure of the gas decreases by half.

<math alttext="delta S equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because the average kinetic energy of the gas particles is unchanged.

<math alttext="delta S is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because the gas particles become dispersed in a larger volume.
